target_title: Support locally-installed HTML documentation generated from Texinfo

note.body:
I assume that Yelp hasn't had any updates in years because the program is complete. All the mentions of it I could find online still refer to it as the "GNOME help browser". If there is another help browser that is more appropriate to work on then I'd like to know about it.

I found accessing man and info pages in Yelp quite hard and issue #186 says the same.

If the only blocker is that somebody needs to work on it, then I'd be interested in working on it myself. However, I thought I should get some feedback from whoever is likely to review my code before I start a large amount of work. I'd probably start with issue #186 to get familiar with the code and contributing to Yelp development.

target_title: Support locally-installed HTML documentation generated from Texinfo

note.body:
> but has received no further development for several years

[Sounds a bit like Yelp](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/commits/master)? :P

> but I was hoping that support for local HTML manuals could be integrated into yelp or another GUI help browser

What's currently blocking this?

target_title: Support locally-installed HTML documentation generated from Texinfo

note.body: I would make the text smaller and the pill smaller, it should not be bigger than the title imo, but it is already quite an improvement, specially if it works both in dark/light modes.

I ended up remaking the AdwStatusPage in HTML:

![image](/uploads/3a9fc3225fd27ad10d8ddde78fb1c701/image.png)

(Right now it uses standard libadwaita window colors, could be switched to use the view color instead (needs design opinions). Also I still need to figure out how to replicate the button lighting up on hover, and I still need to apply the accent color...)
Resolved in 77c87d0b.
Resolved in 77c87d0b.
That sounds good to me.

Should be

    gtk_search_bar_connect_entry (GTK_SEARCH_BAR (priv->search_bar), GTK_EDITABLE (priv->search_entry));
The `developer_name` tag should be kept for compatibility with older parsers.
While the suggested change is correct, I think we will tackle this during/after the GTK 4 port.

Please, also change the file name to `org.gnome.Yelp.appdata.xml.in` (or `org.gnome.Yelp.metainfo.xml.in`), do not change app id without changing the actual metadata file name - that is a bad practice.

Ideally, also rename the [desktop file](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/blob/master/yelp.desktop.in?ref_type=heads) to `org.gnome.Yelp.desktop.in`.

(But don't change the gsettings schema id.)

After these files are renamed, you will also need to update their names in [Makefile.am](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/blob/master/Makefile.am?ref_type=heads), [configure.ac](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/blob/master/configure.ac?ref_type=heads), [po/POTFILES.in](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/blob/master/po/POTFILES.in?ref_type=heads), [po/POTFILES.skip](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/blob/master/po/POTFILES.skip?ref_type=heads) and maybe other places.

You will also need to change the desktop file name [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/-/blob/main/data/org.gnome.shell.gschema.xml.in?ref_type=heads#L139).

See the [previous MR](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/merge_requests/10) for more details.

TBH I've been considering replacing the whole style with something more similar to Web's suggestions:

![image](/uploads/48785f88df5a70b9dc088b05712d4514/image.png)

I'll try to implement this in a bit.

It seems to me that it's theme-related. I get the same colors on GTK3 with the adw-gtk3 theme:

![image](/uploads/a25f3756fb62cbad81ce15187922265c/image.png)

But when I switch to Adwaita and restart, it looks like this:

![image](/uploads/153df2c7ffa2062742721a2894c347ab/image.png)

(...in general, I still need to look into colors/content styling...)
this is not a bug in the port, the colors are already broken like that on a lot of locales other than english

this would block the webview's navigation gestures, so it will be not possible to swipe back from the error page

(at least that's why epiphany does it afaik)

The style here is off

![image](/uploads/dac14b895a24210104825adde47194a9/image.png)

The icons should be replaced by symbolics, the background has the wrong color and selection should match the style of [`.menu`](https://gnome.pages.gitlab.gnome.org/libadwaita/doc/main/style-classes.html#menu-popovers).
See https://gitlab.gnome.org/knuxify/yelp/-/merge_requests/5, perhaps it could be merged as is until `settings: Notify about font-adjustment at init` if that fixes the issue.
We can't use a full-width search bar because we already have one. I think we can settle for now with the correct background style, rounded corners and having a close button.

We could switch YelpSearchEntry to subclass AdwBin, then store the SearchEntry inside of the bin (and half-relatedly, we still need to switch away from entry completions and make a custom popover for search suggestions - Web/Epiphany has relevant code in its location entry widget, though they don't use a search entry but a regular entry there).

Probably also worth raising in the design issue: https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/-/issues/116

Some more examples:

GNOME Text Editor uses a similar popover to Yelp that connects to the top bar:

![image](/uploads/9335474d6e3fba4a2fe4ce7659d592e1/image.png)

Web/Epiphany uses a search bar:

![image](/uploads/a39b7b557dcb817e3e2137df70a5b782/image.png)
I will open a MR.

Console has a very nice widget to display the font size in its menu, I say we copy it.

![image](/uploads/14f3516e2eaa4314afbf2ef4c0109700/image.png)

No strong opinion here, but the colors of the icon look different:

GTK 3:

![image](/uploads/f1f8e0a2b9c99984ca21f49dc9844d5e/image.png)

GTK 4:

![image](/uploads/b7149fe8b1551a2afd3dbbf1dd6bc8e5/image.png)

The foreground is the same but the background changed.

From the contrast app:

![image](/uploads/a9b2e4191aeab05a9bd6d7fa9999f117/image.png)

The top search (Ctrl+S) does not close with <kbd>Escape</kbd> and does not have a loupe button (edit-find-symbolic from the icon devkit) like the web view's search.

I think it would be preferable to use a regular GtkSearchEntry here, but that widget is final and can't be subclassed. One could always use a regular object (with a reference to the search entry) that manages the search entry.

The search bar on the content is a bit odd, 

![image](/uploads/d3c698c431ccf04f726918456c7f01ca/image.png)

compare it with Biblioteca's

![image](/uploads/c8e1b1a5a6a96bb8ebf9f3b601d3de19/image.png)

- We are missing a close button
- The background color looks very odd against the headerbar colors
- Not enough round corners

There are some design questions I am not sure about. Biblioteca is floating and has linked buttons, perhaps neither are a good fit here.

Fixed in 6b2866c9ef7271bf3d3c69bd3048082fef250d5f. As far as I can tell, fetching GtkSettings early got it confused (my hypothesis is that we end up with 2 GtkSettings created, and the wrong one gets the font set, but the one that belongs to the window/display(?) doesn't... would need to verify).

Checked the git blame; it was added in c8dead31bf670a65877f7316a75db443a1e686bd, the relevant present code was later moved to be X11-only in 81c4eead48192e41384e6096f122524c7e0e695e, and I removed the whole X11-specific block. [gtk_window_present_with_time is deprecated](https://docs.gtk.org/gtk4/method.Window.present_with_time.html) in GTK4 in favor of regular window_present.

I ended up just dropping the timestamp property.
I ended up just switching to G_TYPE_STRING; this seems to work both for drag-and-dropping files and URI strings. (It's worth noting that the webview seems to handle its own drag-and-drop.)
Bug: for some reason, the font in the app sets itself to Sans 10 (the GtkSettings default as far as I can tell?) instead of Cantarell 11 (the actual default).
it always was like that afaik

Probably a pre-existing issue, so this is mostly for discussion. I think this is a fonts issue. The manual page

```
yelp 'man:groff(7)'
```

can't handle some unicode:

![image](/uploads/25402989587eef16e7f0f4c6d1b6041e/image.png)

That manual page is available inside the flatpak runtime. For one in the host, probably man:systemd-journald(8)' works.

Perhaps one could hardcode a font here?

Perhaps, in a follow up MR this dialog:

![image](/uploads/d575389fcde43590a8eeb3161abc49eb/image.png)

Could be made into a proper AdwStatusPage.

I didn't handle this specific part. I would suggest asking at the GTK matrix channel or the IRC matrix channel. I get the feeling that 

- One has to check for strings too
- Handle all cases separately: If it is a object, handle the object, if it is a string load the string, etc.
See my comment above, overriding the vfunc is preferable. Yes the code is in the application layer but with the help of a helper exposed at application.h it should be possible to do on the window.
When using custom widgets it is always preferable to override the virtual functions instead of connecting to the signal.
Probably, this is something that can be revisited later.

I am not sure what is the technical difference, but the semantics of a native and a root are somehow different. In general get_root is what it is used to get the main window, however it is preferable to store a pointer as `priv->window` in these cases.
Yeah, it is quite unfortunate that there is a mixed indentation scheme, but trying to address it belongs to a different MR. Thanks!

Wow, thank you so so much for the thorough review!

I've tried to address most of the comments, some of them I left open if I couldn't figure out how to fix them or have yet to look into it. I'd appreciate some guidance as to what to do in those cases.

Done. Out of curiosity, what's the difference? It seemed to me that "get_native" is more explicit in that the requested widget will be a GtkNative, so a window; get_root seemed more "generic" to me instead (though I guess both pretty much always return the same thing anyways).
Sure, though I think this should probably be changed to "Pictures" while we're at it.

Good catch, I forgot to fix this line. In general, both when connecting to unrealize, and when connecting to close-request like you suggest in a later comment, causes a segfault on close; I have yet to look into why that happens.

Certainly could work, I just copied what used to be done here.

(I wanted to check what Epiphany/Web does for this, but it seems that it has no loading cursor? Or it just didn't display on my system for some reason.)

Whoops, didn't realize GUri was a struct, not a GObject... :face_palm:

(Admittedly the specifics of URI handling in drag-and-drop kind of elude me. How did you handle it in your port?)
Do we need to implement close-request, or can we just listen to the `close-request` signal on the application object (remember, this is a function in yelp-application, not yelp-window)?
Yeah, as far as I could tell the timestamp isn't used anywhere; figured keeping it would be useful if we ever need to... deduplicate? No clue what it would be useful for, though.

> I don't think I have ever seen this pattern before

Me neither :D I assume that this is meant to work around a case where "save file" is clicked, the window is closed before the save operation finishes, then the error occurs before the app closing timeout occurs. But that sounds very unlikely.

(Half-relatedly - there should probably be a toast when the saving finishes successfully; perhaps some of the other functions (copy code and such?) could use such a pattern as well.)

It seemed to work from my testing. Either way, this whole property can be dropped now, see my previous comments.

(That yelp-help-list (the "All Help" dialog) has no icons for most apps is a separate issue entirely, and happens in the GTK3 version as well; it tries to find the application by its help document name, but fails since it's not the actual app ID.)
I assume this generally applies to  43d405cc430802980d7ec30d809bfbac85e8edbc; in which case, yeah, it indeed makes diffing a bit more difficult. I'll drop these changes (will require a force push).

Whoops, didn't realize there was a way to get the display without having a pointer to a widget/window :p

The `gtk-icon-theme` property could be dropped from YelpSettings then, I only kept it for this one specific purpose. (Keeping this open so that I don't forget to do this.)
Thanks! I will backport this to https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/merge_requests/56 once it is a bit more stabilized.
Fair, I've dropped the reordering.
Posted some comments. Again, thanks a lot for working on this!
Please set `"buildsystem": "meson"`.
I don't think this is necessary as per my previous comment.
Both buttons are missing a tooltip-text. All image-only buttons need a tooltip-text.
The box shouldn't be linked, `.flat` in the buttons and spacing=6 in the box is enough.

Missing

                            <property name="primary">True</property>
This valign shouldn't be needed on buttons on a headerbar (afaik).
gtk_widget_set_cursor_from_name is shorter
The docs for gdk_cursor_new_from_name contain images for all cursors. Perhaps "progress" is more appropiate?
Please use gtk_widget_set_halign.
will this work if the GValue holds a G_TYPE_URI but not a GObject?
missing a space in between the `settings` and the `(`.
You can override the GtkWidgets's unrealize vfunc https://docs.gtk.org/gtk4/method.Widget.unrealize.html.
I don't think this timestamp is use anywhere. Perhaps this issue predates the port.
This is done by default by AdwApplication, please remove this.
I don't think I have ever seen this pattern before, perhaps it is better to just present it with `window` always, even if it is not visible.
gtk_file_dialog_set_initial_folder (dialog, g_get_user_special_dir (G_USER_DIRECTORY_DESKTOP));
Use gtk_widget_get_root in contexts like this instead. However YelpSaveData has a `data->window` if I am not mistaken.
The wayland equivalnt can be get via gdk_wayland_toplevel_export_handle, but no idea if the package kit API supports that.

Please add a             
```
adw_alert_dialog_set_default_response (ADW_ALERT_DIALOG (dialog), "close");
```

so enter closes the dialog.
The app shouldn't have any X11 specific code.
Do not listen for changes in GTK themes, themes are not supported with libadwaita.
Please double check if using a `new` one works, it might be necessary to get the default one as I described above.
Please rename the function, it should also take a AdwStyleManager instead of a GObject as first parameter.
Please use the `G_CALLBACK` macro.
This is part of the GTK_SETTINGS property. I would suggest to do this in the `init` function.
also unnecessary changes.
This is not a nullable, this check can't fail, this is explained in the docs for gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon. However get_file and get_uri can both return `NULL`.

Unnecessary. Just to be clear, I have no issue with these changes, but they make MRs unnecessarily harder to review, which becomes a big problem in a module which does not see much activity to begin with.
Please either get it via `priv->gtk_icon_theme` or similar. Note that you can get the default icon them via `gtk_icon_theme_get_for_display (gdk_display_get_default ())`.
I opened 2 MRs with some changes, please enable notifications for new MRs against your repo :).

Oh, neat! Wasn't aware anyone else was working on a port at the same time :p Either way, any help/MRs would be greatly appreciated; admittedly this is my first time doing GTK app dev in C, there's certainly things I could've done better :)

Please document where the colors come from.

My port uses the colors at https://gnome.pages.gitlab.gnome.org/libadwaita/doc/main/css-variables.html#window-colors, perhaps the ones from view are more appropriate but please document it with a link.

I also have a port in the works that I started yesterday

![image](/uploads/f12860dae686323c427ac9f59981f010/image.png)

I will open MRs against yours.

Thanks for working on this!

It would be interesting to add the app-id bits in https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/yelp/-/merge_requests/10, apps need a proper app id in GTK 4.
I would think that mailing list were discontinued.
Please do not reorder the fields, it makes the diff hard to follow. Please either do it in a follow up MR, or in a separate commit.
